meanings.definition: Ionophores: a substance that facilitates the transport of ions across a cell membrane
meanings.sent1: The ionophores helped the ions move through the cell membrane efficiently.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study ionophores to understand how ions pass through cell membranes.
meanings.sent3: The ionophores decided to take a break and let the ions figure out their own way across the cell membrane.
meanings.sent4: Like tiny ferry boats, ionophores carried the ions safely across the cell membrane.
meanings.sent5: The ionophores acted as gatekeepers, allowing only specific ions to pass through the cell membrane.

meanings.definition: Ionophores: a type of antibiotic used in veterinary medicine
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian prescribed ionophores to treat the infection in the farm animals.
meanings.sent2: Farmers rely on ionophores to keep their livestock healthy.
meanings.sent3: The ionophores threw a party in the petri dish to celebrate their antibiotic properties.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against bacteria, ionophores were the knights in shining armor.
meanings.sent5: The ionophores worked tirelessly to combat bacterial infections in the animals.
